economic_context.details: Denyse was poor and received alms distributed by Symon Sallet. Multiple incidents triggered by refusal of charity: servant refused to pour wine into her hand, maid refused bread, she was not paid as much as usual for spinning work. Economic vulnerability and dependence on charity appears central to conflicts.

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial ended with accused's death in prison on May 21, 1598, found naked with no signs of violence or suicide. PG des Vosges ordered burial near cemetery since she was not a suicide and formal sentence had not been passed. Proceedings ordered against Colardote and daughter based on Denyse's accusations. Very detailed confessions without torture. Pattern of revenge killings following refusal of charity (wine, bread, payment). Magical herb central to method - could kill or cure, but medical intervention blocked healing power. Detailed sabbat description. Economic vulnerability and charity dependence central to conflicts.
